Activity: Arrive at the office. Check emails. Get a coffee.

Continue testing and refining the statistical arbitrage trading strategies. Focus on robustness and sensitivity analysis to ensure the strategies are not overly sensitive to market conditions or data errors.

Investigate any unexpected results or performance anomalies observed during backtesting. Debug the code and data to identify the root cause. If necessary, consult @Sdev-1 or @Sdev-2 if I think the debugging effort will take too long.
Lunch. Networking with @dsde-1 over in the cafeteria to pick up some hints and advice from them

Prepare the slides for presenting preliminary findings and strategies to the CIO and Quantitative Research team. Structure the presentation to cover the following topics: Data Overview, Statistical Analysis, Data Preprocessing, Trading Strategies, Backtesting Results, and Future Research Directions.

Practice the presentation to ensure a smooth delivery and effective communication of the key findings. Anticipate potential questions and prepare answers. Perhaps, also do some push-ups to release the stress

Send the presentation slides to @Qres-1, @Qres-2, @Qres-3 for review and feedback before the presentation. This allows them to prepare any questions and identify areas for improvement. Subject: Presentation Slides for Review - Statistical Arbitrage Strategies
